intro: Erythranthe andicola, commonly known as the Andean erythranthe, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions, it is considered a valuable species for ecological studies in mountainous regions.
